question_text: Which of the following are valid characteristics of DHCP reservations? (Select all that apply)
answer_options: They are based on the device’s MAC address
They require configuration on the DHCP server
They prevent the need for static configuration on client devices
They require disabling DHCP on the client
They function across subnets by default
correct_answer: They are based on the device’s MAC address
They require configuration on the DHCP server
They prevent the need for static configuration on client devices
explanation: Reservations use the MAC address to assign a consistent IP and are configured server-side, eliminating the need for static setup on clients.
